name: AI-Powered DeFi Evaluation
description: Comprehensive evaluation template for AI-powered DeFi applications, focusing on AI model quality, DeFi integration, risk management, and market analysis capabilities
author: Shai Perednik

categories.name: AI Capabilities
categories.description: Evaluation of AI model quality, training methods, and implementation

metrics.name: AI Model Type & Architecture
metrics.description: Type of AI model used and its architectural sophistication

thresholds.T0: Uses state-of-the-art models (advanced LLMs, transformers, deep reinforcement learning) specifically tuned for financial applications with verifiable performance metrics
thresholds.T1: Implements standard machine learning models (regression, classification, basic neural networks) with decent performance for financial tasks

metrics.name: Training Data Quality
metrics.description: Quality, diversity, and relevance of training data for financial applications

thresholds.T0: Uses high-quality, diverse financial datasets with extensive historical coverage; implements rigorous data validation; updates training data regularly; addresses potential biases
thresholds.T1: Uses adequate financial datasets with reasonable coverage; basic data cleaning procedures; periodic data updates

metrics.name: Model Performance & Accuracy
metrics.description: Demonstrated accuracy and performance metrics in financial prediction tasks

thresholds.T0: Consistently outperforms market benchmarks; prediction accuracy >80% for major use cases; low false positive rates; robust performance in varied market conditions
thresholds.T1: Matches or slightly exceeds market benchmarks; prediction accuracy >65% for major use cases; acceptable error rates; performs adequately in normal market conditions

tools: Stress Testing Under Various Market Conditions

metrics.name: AI Explainability
metrics.description: Transparency and explainability of AI decision-making processes

thresholds.T0: Implements advanced explainable AI techniques; provides detailed reasoning for decisions; visualization tools for model interpretability; transparent about model limitations
thresholds.T1: Basic explanation of model decisions; some level of transparency in decision processes; acknowledges limitations

categories.name: DeFi Integration
categories.description: Evaluation of DeFi protocol integration and functionality

metrics.name: Protocol Support & Interoperability
metrics.description: Range and quality of supported DeFi protocols and cross-chain capabilities

thresholds.T0: Seamless integration with 10+ major DeFi protocols across multiple blockchains; cross-chain operability; adapts to protocol updates automatically; minimal integration failures
thresholds.T1: Integration with 3-5 major DeFi protocols; primarily single-chain; manual updates for protocol changes; occasional integration issues

metrics.name: Liquidity Access & Management
metrics.description: Ability to access, analyze, and efficiently utilize liquidity pools

thresholds.T0: Optimizes routing across multiple liquidity sources; minimizes slippage through AI-driven path finding; accurately predicts and adapts to liquidity shifts; performs well even with low liquidity assets
thresholds.T1: Basic routing across main liquidity pools; reasonable slippage management; functions well with high-liquidity assets

metrics.name: Transaction Execution Efficiency
metrics.description: Speed, cost-effectiveness, and success rate of AI-driven transactions

thresholds.T0: Optimal gas management with predictive gas pricing; >98% transaction success rate; MEV protection; sub-second decision-making; transaction batching where beneficial
thresholds.T1: Standard gas management; >90% transaction success rate; basic MEV awareness; reasonable execution speeds

metrics.name: Smart Contract Interaction
metrics.description: Quality and safety of AI interaction with DeFi smart contracts

thresholds.T0: Advanced contract analysis before interaction; uses formal verification; simulates transactions before execution; handles contract failures gracefully; identifies potential exploits
thresholds.T1: Basic contract verification; standard error handling; reasonable safety measures for high-value transactions

categories.name: Risk Management
categories.description: Evaluation of AI-powered risk assessment and mitigation capabilities

metrics.name: Risk Assessment
metrics.description: Quality and comprehensiveness of AI-driven risk assessment

thresholds.T0: Multi-factor risk modeling incorporating market, protocol, and technical risks; real-time adaptation to changing conditions; stress testing capabilities; historical risk backtesting with proven accuracy
thresholds.T1: Basic risk scoring for major risks; periodic risk reassessment; some historical validation of risk models

metrics.name: Safety Measures & Circuit Breakers
metrics.description: Implementation and effectiveness of protection mechanisms

thresholds.T0: Automated circuit breakers with multiple trigger conditions; gradual position unwinding; emergency response system with human oversight options; proven effectiveness during market stress
thresholds.T1: Basic threshold-based circuit breakers; reasonably effective protection mechanisms; manual override capabilities

metrics.name: Regulatory Compliance & Adaptability
metrics.description: Compliance with financial regulations and ability to adapt to regulatory changes

thresholds.T0: Proactive regulatory compliance framework; jurisdiction-specific rule enforcement; automated compliance updates; detailed audit trails; AML/KYC integration where applicable
thresholds.T1: Basic compliance measures; reasonable adaptation to major regulatory changes; standard record keeping

metrics.name: Incident Response
metrics.description: Effectiveness of response to exploits, vulnerabilities, or system failures

thresholds.T0: Automated detection of anomalies and exploits; rapid response system with <15 min reaction time; comprehensive recovery procedures; learns from incidents to improve security
thresholds.T1: Standard monitoring for major issues; documented response procedures; reasonable recovery mechanisms

categories.name: Market Analysis
categories.description: Evaluation of AI-powered market analysis and prediction capabilities

metrics.name: Market Data Sources
metrics.description: Quality, diversity, and integration of market data sources

thresholds.T0: Integrates 15+ high-quality data sources across on-chain, exchange, and alternative data; real-time data processing; redundant data providers; data quality verification systems
thresholds.T1: Uses 5-10 standard data sources; reasonable data freshness; basic data quality checks

metrics.name: Market Prediction Accuracy
metrics.description: Historical accuracy of market predictions and forecasts

thresholds.T0: Consistent outperformance of market benchmarks by >15%; accurate directional predictions (>75%); effective in both trending and ranging markets; transparent track record with third-party verification
thresholds.T1: Matches or slightly exceeds benchmarks; reasonable directional accuracy (>60%); performs adequately in normal market conditions

metrics.name: Analysis Sophistication
metrics.description: Depth and sophistication of market analysis methodologies

thresholds.T0: Multi-model ensemble approach combining technical, fundamental, sentiment, and on-chain analysis; correlation awareness across assets; regime detection; anomaly identification
thresholds.T1: Standard technical and fundamental analysis; basic sentiment analysis; reasonable analytical framework

metrics.name: Strategy Adaptation
metrics.description: Ability to adapt strategies based on changing market conditions

thresholds.T0: Autonomous strategy evolution based on market regime; learns from past performance; effectively shifts between defensive and aggressive postures; maintains performance across market cycles
thresholds.T1: Manual or semi-automated strategy adjustments; reasonable adaptation to major market shifts; performs adequately in trending markets

categories.name: User Experience & Accessibility
categories.description: Evaluation of interface quality, customization options, and accessibility

metrics.name: Interface Quality & Clarity
metrics.description: Usability and clarity of the user interface for AI-DeFi interactions

thresholds.T0: Intuitive, responsive interface across devices; clear visualization of AI decisions and actions; real-time updates; customizable dashboards; excellent accessibility features
thresholds.T1: Functional interface with reasonable usability; adequate information display; standard accessibility compliance

metrics.name: AI Customization Options
metrics.description: Degree to which users can customize AI behavior and risk parameters

thresholds.T0: Extensive customization of risk profiles, strategies, and preferences; fine-grained control over AI autonomy; personalized insights tailored to user goals; maintains performance across customizations
thresholds.T1: Basic customization options; several preset profiles; reasonable adaptability to user preferences

metrics.name: Operational Transparency
metrics.description: Transparency of AI operations, decisions, and performance metrics

thresholds.T0: Complete transparency of actions and decision logic; comprehensive reporting; performance attribution; fee transparency; third-party verification capabilities
thresholds.T1: Standard reporting of major actions and outcomes; reasonable transparency about decision factors; clear fee structure

metrics.name: Educational Resources
metrics.description: Quality and comprehensiveness of educational materials for users

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive educational content explaining AI strategies; interactive tutorials; personalized learning paths; responsive support; actively maintained knowledge base
thresholds.T1: Basic documentation; standard tutorials; reasonable support channels
